title: 820-00281 No Power
message:
HEy I am working on a 820-00281 with no power. So usb meter was sticking at 5v with 32amps when i started. Noticed corrosion on CB300 which is PP3v3_G3H. Removed that cap and now I get 20v (sometimes at 1.4 amps, sometimes at 14amps or sometimes at 5 amps.

PPDCIN_G3H is missing
PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS is missing

Do you think it is CD3215 chips?

PPBUS_G3H is 1v

title: 820-00281 No Power
message:
You've said to get 20V at USB-C inputs now.
Each USB-C port has its VBUS line; you must check each port separately.
CD3215 chips should be good, if switch to 20V.
Check if all ports have the same behaviour.

title: 820-00281 No Power
message:
All ports have same behavior but anos at 5,47 which is a little high. let me give some more details

PP20V_USBC_TA_VBUS 20v
PP20V_USBC_TA_VBUS_F 20v
PPDCIN_G3H missing
PP20V_USBC_TB_VBUS missing
PP20V_USBC_TB_VBUS_F missing

Could it be the B controller?

title: 820-00281 No Power
message: nevermind only the A mesurements will be right as the side it is plugged in. dumb question

title: 820-00281 No Power
message: so essentially no PPDIN_g3H where do I look

title: 820-00281 No Power
message:
Please confirm, do you get 20V at USB-C voltmeter, but 0V at R7020???
That is impossible; it will imply no 3V3_G3H present, and CD3215 chips cannot switch to 20V.
Are you using original 87W charger?

title: 820-00281 No Power
message: R7022 and r7021 shorted to ground. I see both run to r7030 I believe. Don't have schematic on me. I will check it in the morning

title: 820-00281 No Power
message: So you have a short to ground at R7020?
